DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value that represents the cutoff ratio for FISH testing used to determine whether the patient was positive for HER2/ERBB2.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: ERBB2 Gene Centromere Integer::17 Copy Number Analysis Positive Finding Cutoff Ratio
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._This gene plays a role in cellular proliferation and is involved in the oncogenic process through amplification and/or overexpression in several cancers._The nonstaining primary constriction of a chromosome which is the point of attachment of the spindle fiber; provides the mechanism of chromosome movement during cell division; the centromere divides the chromosome into two arms, and its position is constant for a specific chromosome: near one end (acrocentric), near the center (metacentric), or between (submetacentric)._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::17_The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium._Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it._A designated limit beyond which something cannot function, must be terminated, or no longer applies._Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ObjectClass.preferredName: HER2/neu Centromere Integer::17 Copy Number Analysis Positive Finding
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The ERBB2 Gene at 17q21.1 encodes ERRB2 Receptor Protein Tyrosine Kinase, a 185 kD type I membrane glycoprotein that controls cell growth with features similar to EGFR. Ligand binding increases phosphorylation of tyrosine residues. A potential heterodimer with ERBB3 and ERBB4 receptors, p185ERBB2 is an essential component of the heregulin/neuregulin receptor complex. ERBB2 homodimers do not bind heregulin but ERBB2/ERBB3 heterodimers do. Neuregulins do not interact with ERBB2 alone. The IL6 cytokine induces tyrosine phosphorylation of ERBB2 and ERBB3, but not EGFR. ERBB2 forms an IL6-dependent complex with the IL6R gp130 subunit resulting in MAPK activation. Expressed in fetal kidney and liver, herstatin is a 68 kD secreted product of an alternative ERBB2 transcript that retains intron 8. Herstatin binds p185ERBB2 as an inhibitor by disrupting ERBB2 dimers and reducing p185 tyrosine phosphorylation.  (from SWISS-PROT, OMIM and NCI):The nonstaining primary constriction of a chromosome which is the point of attachment of the spindle fiber; provides the mechanism of chromosome movement during cell division; the centromere divides the chromosome into two arms, and its position is constant for a specific chromosome: near one end (acrocentric), near the center (metacentric), or between (submetacentric).:A number with no fractional part.::17:The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.:Analysis; examination and interpretation.:An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in cellular proliferation and is involved in the oncogenic process through amplification and/or overexpression in several cancers.

The nonstaining primary constriction of a chromosome which is the point of attachment of the spindle fiber; provides the mechanism of chromosome movement during cell division; the centromere divides the chromosome into two arms, and its position is constant for a specific chromosome: near one end (acrocentric), near the center (metacentric), or between (submetacentric).
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.

Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.
A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Property.preferredDefinition: A designated limit beyond which something cannot function, must be terminated, or no longer applies.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

Concepts.definition: A designated limit beyond which something cannot function, must be terminated, or no longer applies.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for TCGA BRCA CDF form per request by K.Wildermuth. mc 3/11/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number to establish what the cutoff is for the assay.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98):A designated limit beyond which something cannot function or must be terminated.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.
A designated limit beyond which something cannot function, must be terminated, or no longer applies.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
